alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Hot Spring; Pike (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 2:22PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clark, northeastern Pike, southeastern Montgomery and southwestern Hot Spring Counties through 245 PM CST... At 221 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Narrows Dam, or 9 miles northeast of Murfreesboro, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro... Glenwood... Amity... Caddo Valley... DeGray Lake State Park... Lofton... Friendship... Bismarck... Alpine... Lower Lake Recreation Area... Salem in Pike County... Bonnerdale... Welsh... Shawmut... Rosboro... Pike City... De Roche... Point Cedar... Kirby... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CST for southwestern Arkansas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for southwestern Arkansas.
